Package pie.ilikepiefoo.fabric.events.sleep

Class AllowNearbyMonstersEventJS

java.lang.Object

pie.ilikepiefoo.fabric.events.sleep.AllowNearbyMonstersEventJS
public class AllowNearbyMonstersEventJS extends dev.latvian.mods.kubejs.player.PlayerEventJS
An event that checks whether players can sleep when monsters are nearby.

This event can also be used to force a failing result, meaning it can do custom monster checks.

  • Method Details

    • handler

      public static net.minecraft.world.InteractionResult handler (net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player, net.minecraft.core.BlockPos sleepingPos, boolean vanillaResult)
      Checks whether a player can sleep when monsters are nearby.

      Non-passing return values cancel further callbacks.

      Parameters:
      player - the sleeping player
      sleepingPos - the (possibly still unset) sleeping position of the player
      vanillaResult - true if vanilla's monster check succeeded (there were no monsters), false otherwise
      Returns:
      InteractionResult.SUCCESS to allow sleeping, InteractionResult.FAIL to prevent sleeping, InteractionResult.PASS to fall back to other callbacks
